newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Two Colombian marines killed in Bogota attack.
newsitem.headline: Two Colombian marines killed in Bogota attack.

text.p: Two Colombian marines were killed and one was wounded on Friday in an attack by suspected leftist guerrillas in central Bogota, authorities said.
Police said the attack occurred at 6:17 a.m. (1117 GMT) outside a building housing a recruitment centre for the Colombian Navy.
Two men and a woman attacked the marines, who were on sentry duty outside the building in the Teusaquillo district, with bursts of automatic gunfire, a spokesman for the Metropolitan Police said.
One of the victims was killed instantly and the other died shortly afterwards at a local hospital.
"It was militias," the spokesman said, referring to urban commandos belonging to one of the two leading guerrilla groups operating across Colombia.

He said the attack may have been in reprisal for the killing of four Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC) rebels on Thursday evening during a shootout in the town of Sibate, 20 miles (32 km) outside the capital.

Military officials blame the FARC, Colombia's largest and oldest guerrilla group, for a powerful bomb that exploded on Thursday morning in a town in Colombia's notoriously violent northwest banana-growing region of Uraba that killed at least 10 people and left nearly 50 injured.
